title: The Bachelor's Noni Janur makes a surprise appearance on Millionaire Hot Seat
text:
She failed to find love with Richie Strahan on The Bachelor in 2016.

And on Monday night, Noni Janur swapped reality TV for Channel Nine game show Millionaire Hot Seat - but found herself equally unsuccessful.

The 27-year-old cosmetic clinic manager didn't win any money and, rather embarrassingly, answered only one question correctly.

Guess who's back! The Bachelor star Noni Janur made a surprise appearance on Channel Nine's Millionaire Hot Seat on Monday night, but failed to win any money

After making her way over to the red seat, host Eddie McGuire introduced Noni as a former Bachelor contestant.

He said: 'You are a cosmetic clinic manager and a bikini shop owner and designer at Bondi Beach.

'You were on The Bachelor, you introduced yourself with a bouquet of bacon flowers then [became] known as the bacon girl!'

Embarrassing! The 27-year-old cosmetic clinic manager answered only one question correctly

Noni laughed before explaining to Eddie why she had given Richie a 'bacon bouquet' at the first cocktail party.

'So when you're asked to come on The Bachelor, you have to give [him] a present and the only thing I could think about was something that everyone loves, which would be bacon!' she said.

The brunette went on to reveal how her love affair with bacon started, adding that she even has the word tattooed on her ankle.

Claim to fame: After making her way over to the red seat, Eddie McGuire introduced Noni as a former Bachelor contestant and told the audience about her first meeting with Richie Strahan

'It kind of began with my friends and I, we call each other "beer-con" [in the] way a Jamaican would say "bacon",' she began.

'And it was Taco Tuesday in Bali and they give away free tattoos, so we all got "bacon" tattooed on our ankles.'

'So that's why I rolled them up, put them in the flowers and gave it to [Richie],' she concluded.
description: The 27-year-old cosmetic clinic manager failed to win any money on the game show, answering only one question correctly
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
